[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”3.22.3″ max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” custom_padding=”0|0px|3px|0px|false|false”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_margin=”2px|auto||auto||” custom_padding=”3px|||||”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.27.4″ text_font=”|600|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ text_orientation=”center” max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center”]

Passing with third man runners is a passing sequence that can be used to practice passing technique, work on combination play, or as a warm-up.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://ts-uploads.azureedge.net/marketing/2020/01/passes-with-third-man-runners.png” align_tablet=”center” align_phone=”” align_last_edited=”on|desktop” _builder_version=”3.23″ max_width=”85%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”4px|0px|33px|0px|false|false”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.27.4″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center”]

Set Up

For this exercise position your team as shown in the diagram. One line of players starts next to a mini goal, one player starts at the side of the drill, and two players start at the top of the drill. The players in the starting line by the goal start with the balls. This diagram shows two groups doing the exercise side by side.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.27.4″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center”]

How It Works

First the starting player passes out to the player at the side of the drill who then passes with one touch to the player at the top furthest from them. The other player at the top makes their run towards the goal at the same time this is happening. The player making the run recieves a pass and finishes on goal.

All players rotate to the position where they made their pass. The player who passes the ball into the goal rotates to the back of the starting line.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.2.2″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” hover_enabled=”0″]

Coaching Points

Communication and awareness are vital attributes in a football match and this exercise gives players an opportunity to work on communication skills by calling out the names of the players they are passing to.

In addition, in a match movement off the ball is vital and the run into space from the third man runner can help form this habit.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
